Articles.Content:
The first batch of parts is now available. They are roughly balanced, and almost fully operational. The only real problem is the lack of colliders in the wings since they cause issues when retracted.

The parts can be found[here.](https://www.dropbox.com/s/3dvkxu19q1hgr4v/GameData.zip?dl=0)

[Source](https://www.dropbox.com/s/smlef0rzt4etk3f/Animate2VariableSource.txt?dl=0)

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

Update: 21-06-15 (UK date system, suck it).

New part added (stacked deployable propeller)

All textures changed to DDS.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T18:56:00Z" title="06/21/2015 06:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by electronicfox**
Eve cloud-city, with cloud diving planes for fun!
This is looking good ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I love the idea, Wish ya the best of luck with it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Uh.. those are AWESOME!
Theres just a few bits I need to learn before I can get to the primary tests of these. The main ones being how to make items with a deploy button, and how to get that blimp part working like a blimp.
ask Hooligan about the blimp, he did the hooligan labs blimps mod
Oh my god this looks promising!![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)
I love this idea!! Keep at it!! You sir are a steely eyed missle man!

Well I've got the animation bit down. I know how to make engines work with FireSpitter already so thats no problem. I need to figure out wings though, and I need to ask Hooligan how the blimp setup works.

![pack.gif](https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5R-jAIWAtRY/VWYktvdrEsI/AAAAAAAAD0M/blR3fyreN3I/s1600/pack.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-27T20:16:08Z" title="05/27/2015 08:16  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 27, 2015</time> by electronicfox**
Man this is like a kid in a candy store, I want I want must have it all ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

cool stuff. subscribed.

I wonder if it works on duna to move cargo (as alternative to land / plane / rocket based means of transport)

![M7rXDDy.png](http://i.imgur.com/M7rXDDy.png)

pic: Jan Kaliciak, [http://www.eosmarsprogram.org/Page32-04-Aerial.html](http://www.eosmarsprogram.org/Page32-04-Aerial.html)

also yay for recoverable booster stages:

![p46_baikal1.jpg](http://www.terranischer-club-eden.com/images/p46_baikal1.jpg)

(Russian Baikal booster with retractable winglet)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-27T20:27:46Z" title="05/27/2015 08:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 27, 2015</time> by riocrokite**

> 
> cool stuff. subscribed.
> I wonder if it works on duna to move containers (as alternative to land / plane / rocket based means of transport)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/M7rXDDy.png](http://i.imgur.com/M7rXDDy.png)
> 
> pic: Jan Kaliciak, [http://www.eosmarsprogram.org/Page32-04-Aerial.html](http://www.eosmarsprogram.org/Page32-04-Aerial.html)

Duna has a thin atmosphere. so it wont work for anything particularly heavy, not unless you use REALLY big balloons.
will need a way to save stuff on rails while floating stable... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
wow those designs are awesome man, looking forward to seeing where this is going!

> 
> will need a way to save stuff on rails while floating stable... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Either land, or pack a KAS anchor.

Interesting concepts.

I have some concerns about the retracting fan fuselage - since the fan on one side is axially offset from the fan on the other side, wouldn't that cause a net torque in the fuselage?

> 
> Interesting concepts.
> I have some concerns about the retracting fan fuselage - since the fan on one side is axially offset from the fan on the other side, wouldn't that cause a net torque in the fuselage?

So long as the net thrust lines up with the COM of the craft, you can offset engines however you like with no problem. Or at least I've never had issues with such setups.

![thrust.gif](https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qvrEQlCyEfM/VWY5YWzQ4LI/AAAAAAAAD0Y/_nI0BR4igvQ/s1600/thrust.gif)

> 
> So long as the net thrust lines up with the COM of the craft, you can offset engines however you like with no problem. Or at least I've never had issues with such setups.
> [http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qvrEQlCyEfM/VWY5YWzQ4LI/AAAAAAAAD0Y/_nI0BR4igvQ/s1600/thrust.gif](https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qvrEQlCyEfM/VWY5YWzQ4LI/AAAAAAAAD0Y/_nI0BR4igvQ/s1600/thrust.gif)

I see, thanks!
I have managed to work out how to get the blimp working now..now I just need to find a way to stop a module activating until an animation has completed.

> 
> Either land, or pack a KAS anchor.

IIRC, HooliganLabs managed it by manually setting a vessel's state to 'LANDED'.
I really want these parts- especially the balloon part.

Update time. So I have figured out how to blimp, how to throw animations into the parts and how to do things in general (although the blimp has a tendency to float way before the deploy animation is finished). The technical side is covered for now.

Now its time to pretty up some things, have a teaser.

![blimpspin.gif](https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1BUCB9qWzQM/VWdc59BLCQI/AAAAAAAAD0o/Oy2Xjp0BddM/s1600/blimpspin.gif)

Yes, I included some solar panels atop the blimp, inspired by the Nasa design for their Venus airships.

Looks Great ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I'll take 6 for now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
How big is that (i.e. what sort of lifting capacity)? It looks amazing!
